reviewText: Perhaps one of the underrated, completely under-the-radar, unpolished gems of 2013. This brawler has wits, good controls, an easy to learn hard to master two-button combat style and some nice visuals going on. I expected a silly, trashy game and I was surprised. Okay, perhaps a bit too linear on the level design. And the borderline cheesy B-movie style cutscenes are not everybody's cup of tea. But I for myself am having a fun time with this game. Not perfect, but lovable in its own way. In the future, this needs a sequel... even if only in spirit. We need more funny silly games like this. (For best experience, this needs to be played with a gamepad, seriously!)
Totally over the top!
Fun silly action game!
Pure action and silly dialogs makes this game amazing, especially the mayan talking mask\n\nworth a play=)

With nothing but mere pocket change, you’ll get this SICK character-action game where you get to play as african-american hero-ish fireman who fights evil chinese businesslord using ancient Mayan magic powers in industrial South American jungle! And that’s just how the game BEGINS!

No but seriously, Marlow Briggs is a VIDEO GAME. It plays kind of like God of War with the feel of hype from games like Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance. You can kind of see that they had low budget making this (cutscene animations will split opinions), but even then it’s extraordinarily high-quality game both visual-, mechanical- and gameplay-wise.

It was originally 15€, and even then it was more than worth it’s prize. if you like God of War, Dante’s Inferno, DmC: Devil May Cry, MGR: Revengeance, Bayonetta or such games, throw money to this game! Way better investment than Assassin’s Creed!

During Steam Sale, when it was 1€, I literally bought 3 of them.
What's wrong with you?  Don't have enough BLACK Aztec/Mayan/whatever Warrior Firefighters in you life?  PLAY MARLOW BRIGG SON!!

Starts well, never changes. Lovely environments. Trivial gameplay. Terrible playable credits which ruin your perception of the creative team. Not really worth it overall, except as a demonstration of how pretty a game you can make on a budget.

I totally recommend this game. I expected something terrible, like Garshasp or Unearthed, but this game is actually pretty good. Not good like it's a AAA game, but good like in a B-Movie way. The developers knew they were making a God of War clone, and they put a lot of humor pointing that out. It's a fun game with some minor gameplay issues and some glitches, and it has some funny moments. I'd recommend it.

Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death (MBATMOD) is a very fine, small Hack-and-Slay action adventure in the likes of God of War and Devil May Cry. It resembles God of War in many ways, you got 4 different weapons, each unlocked at a certain point in the story, 4 different kinds of magic (which aren't that balanced..), and orb-like collectables to upgrade your magic and weapons. it got a very good combo training system. nice visuals for a small title, at certain points it can easily be compared with AAA-titles. but over all that you got the worst screen-tearing! real xbox360 feeling ;) but it doesn't get in the way of the fun you can have with this title. grab it for a discount price and it's a steal! I got around 5hours gameplay on medium. ah, and the difficulty level likes to spike sometimes..so, now go and buy it already. cheers!
Great game, reminds me of God of War. I enjoyed this game better than I did Deadpool.
A cheap God of War Knockoff that cheezy and predictable and fantastic the entire way through.\n\nDefinitely worth $15.
Pure action and silly dialogs makes this game amazing, especially the mayan talking mask\n\nworth a play=)
This game is solid in the controls, has great action, knows how to have fun and is a great, cheap b-movie game. Has some niggles, but totally worth it.

Really had fun with this game. I'd never heard of it before but after watching the trailer I decided that it looked enjoyable... and it was. It's your standard hack and slash action game, with multiple enemies and crushing combos but it's pretty well executed.
The game looks good, with varied and colourful locations, the fighting can get a bit repetitive in places but for the most part the gameplay is nice and varied.
One of the highlights is the tongue-in-cheek humour throughout the game. The game pokes fun at the genre stereotypes and the verbal swordplay" between Marlow and the Mask of Death that accompanies you is often genuinely funny.

The game will take you about 8 hours to finish
date: which is long enough and ensures that the game doesn't become a chore to finish. I would recommend playing on Hard difficulty to have a bit of a challenge."

I would recommend this game knowing I have paid a lot more for a lot worse. Good variation and a lot of fun if you like this kind of game. It all works fine and is full of little surprises.

Surprising solid and well made game. Story is mediocre at best, but the action and platforming are excellent. It isnt the deepest of action games, and it fairly button mashy(its no Devil May Cry). But provides alot of entertainment for a cheap price.\n\nI brought this in the 2014 Summer Sale for 69p. At that price you are crazy not to pick this up and play through it.

A fun and simple game that's worth every penny.  The story seems pretty straight forward.  You come back from the dead to save your girlfriend, stop a greedy ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ mad with ancient power and kill everyone in your way.  So basically, you're a one man zombie apocalypse armed with giant obsidian blades, magic and a wise cracking mask.\nWhile obviously low budget, the game still looks great and the God of War play style is easy to pick up.  The one thing that annoys me is the fixed camera which can be bothersome in some of the many platforming obstacles.\nThe game isn't perfect and doesn't bring anything new to the table, but its still worth checking out.
Spectacular dialogue and fun game play. All the action and puzzles of Tomb Raider with the quick-wit-dialogue of Portal. Especially fun if you like feeling super-powerful.

This game is equal parts [Prototype] and Dark Siders, with a little dash of Devil May Cry sprinkled on top for good measure. In other words, it's a shooty bang-bang hack-n-slash. Only with Ancient magics and Death Gods.

Like a classic '90's action flick, it throws you right into the action and wastes very little time trying to complicate things with story or plot; just enough to move things along from one big explosion to the next - even bigger - explosion. The protagonist, Marlow Briggs, gets the same treatment: he manages to be a little bit of every black action hero all rolled into one, complete with an overly dramatic and painfully stereotypical 'brotha' persona who is just full of less-than-witty one-liners.

That being said, the game delivers on fun and exciting combat and the action is simply over the top. The platforming and 'puzzle' bits could have been a bit more challenging, but they weren't too bad.
Game of the Year, sorry Bioshock Infinite, The Last of Us, Gone Home, or whatever other title might have had the misfortune of releasing in the same year as Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death.

Imagine God of War with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ animations, mediocre graphics, boring puzzles and level desings, bland story and characters, unfair combat and cutscenes that 95% of the time are 3D slideshows.\nIf this game has any redeeming features it's the decent voice acting.\nAll in all, only buy this game if it's 80% off or more and it would still barely be worth its price.

I caught this game on sale. A total surprise.This is one of those games thats lacking a coat of polish,maybe some wax,and a good paint job......Buuuuttt,,Its fun as hell! Its one of those gems i always look for on Steam.Good arcade fun. Think of God of War" meets "Tomb Raider""
I say this game was fun. Ye, somewhat similiar in gameplay of GoW, but with an actual storyline and something interesting, which what most games are missing.
very good game. if you liked the Devil may Cry Series, God of War or Darksiders 1, this game will entertain you for hours.\noh, and pay it with a controller :)

Easily the most underrated game I have ever come across. It is start-to-finish fast-paced hack-n-slash third-person action and fun set-pieces, only slowing down due to the incompetence of the player, yet even then the game is always pushing you in the right direction. At one point I was stuck and the Mask (companion) gave hints within 1 minute of me running around, and another minute later told me to just push the cart into the pistons, which was all I had to do. The game is also very forgiving with a ridiculous frequency of checkpoints.
I wasn't even caring about the collectibles and the game still lasted me about 6 hours, 6 hours of straight and varied action with just a touch of puzzle-solving, no filler whatsoever. Looking back the combat seemed a little repetitive, though I guess that was just me using the same combos over and over. People are right when they say it is similar to God of War, though GOW is not on PC....

The game has an incredibly low asking price on steam, let alone sale price. In terms of value for money, this game is definitely up there. It is easily the best purchase of the summer 2014 sale for me, and one of the best steam purchases ever.
Mindless god of war style hack and slash. Pretty fun, nonstop action
Awesome game!\n
So much cheese and only one man to set things right. Marlow Briggs is perhaps the greatest value of the year so far for a mindless romp through the jungle.

Brought a rain of hellfire upon a group of facist corporate slave factory workers trying to kill me and laughed like a demon child from the farthest floor of hell as I watched them burn and scream in a blood curdling fashion.\n100/10

This game is stupid......... soo stupid that it's actually really really good. I grew up on alot of the 80 and 90s movies so I would enjoy this alot because of how self aware the game is that it's dumb. Highly Recommend it
very good game. if you liked the Devil may Cry Series, God of War or Darksiders 1, this game will entertain you for hours.\noh, and pay it with a controller :)

Best $1.00 I've ever spent, video game wise. Caught this on Steam sale and had a blast. You like cheesy movies? Then you'll love this. awesome game! something like god of war

Looking for a game like God of War but for PC? You're in luck, my friend. This game is a GREAT hack 'n' slasher/spectacle fighter which is VERY underrated and should been given more attention. The game knows that it isn't the greatest game around and that it doesn't have the best story of all time... and that's one of the things that makes it so great - the humor. It doesn't take itself seriously.

You're playing as Marlow Briggs (surprise!) as he is visiting his girlfriend at her new workplace and he... he gets killed... and resurrected by a Mayan death mask. After that, Marlow wants revenge on the one who killed him and to take his girlfriend back from the same guy. Nothing original at all but it does what it's supposed to.

Great game all the way through. Give it a shot!
It's the Commando" (1985) of the hack and slash genre."
Black Kratos
It plays like God of War if God of War were a b movie. Suprisingly detailed levels and the full commitment to it's ridiculousness make this rather enjoyable.

I was gifted this game to play live on stream as a joke. What happened was amazing.

I had some music in the background (completely random) and it seemed to go along with the level I was currently playing.

After a few random songs, we realized that ANY SONG fits with this game as the background music. We ended up turning on my song request bot and my viewers/subs had a great time with this game and picking some hilarious songs to go with the gameplay (somehow hanson's mmmbop works...).

It plays like a God of War title with a super low budget. You can upgrade your abilities as you progress through the game, has some decent animations and some comedic value.

If you're looking for an inexpensive game with character, check out Marlow!

If you want to expirence perhaps, the most mediocore game ever made, then this game is for you!

It copies literally everything from God of War. The Burly screaming muscle head, the combat system, the platforming sections, the wall climbing, the weapons, the magic, executing eniemies, and grabing are ALL EXACTLY like God of War.

Im not agaisnt clones but you need to have something to set yourself apart from the thing you are cloning. The only change here is the combat feels slower and clunkier, they have a black protaganist instead of a white one, and they changed the lore from greek to... african I guess? Im not really sure if the lore is made up or if its based on some tribal history.

And that camera angel... The entire game is fixed camera. Which means it tells you where to go and what to look at and the platforming you'll be doing is harder because you cant judge distance. This means you will fail time and time again trying to make that jump or dodge that moving platform.

The game isnt terrible but when all you offer different from your competition is a change of story then I have to ask, why do you exist?""

Action adventure hack and slash brawler style game full of cheesy fun dialogue. The companion mask in the game reminds me so much of the mask in Crash Bandicoot, this in itself earns the game some pwnage points!
Pretty awesome platformer... Action packed and fun.

Marlow Briggs is an action platformer, with an amateurish art style (mostly the lighting, and unrealistic physics and animations) reminiscient of AAA PC games from the late 90s and early 00s, or more recent XBLA and PSN titles.  Cheesy dialogue, goofy plot and villains, you name it... its like a blast from the past.\n\nThose comments may sound like criticism -- they're not, really.  Marlow Briggs is fun, and worth every penny.  Just don't go into it expecting the kind of drama you get from major titles -- it's not there.  What is there, is campy fun, and lots of explosions, deflecting rockets back at the bad guys with your magic scythe (which makes more explosions), executing brutal combos on bad guys while exploding more stuff off them and then throwing off the nearest cliff.  If you can appreciate that kind of over-the-top fun, you will enjoy Marlow Briggs.
This game is so weirdly good while taking a bunch of cues from other games. 8/10
It certainly not worth the gameplay of DMC, but it's a really good game for his price if you like Beat them all it will please you !
MARLOW BRIGGS YO
If you like a game in wich you can turn off your brain, with some great and fun characters, that has a different story and a good gameplay, this is the game for you.

Is it worth the $6.24 I paid for it on sale? Totally. Is it worth $14.99? No. I would wait for a sale and buy it. For what I paid, it's a very good game. Would I recommend playing it? Sure. It's worth a shot. Very, Indiana Jones meets Prince of Persia: The Forgotten Sands.

Action and adventure, served up with a liberal dose of Death-God humour.  Add in a villain voiced by the amazing James Hong.  Worth playing simply to hear the villain's commentary to his henchmen while the base is being dismantled by our hero (commentary given in the form of public announcements regarding firings via intercom), Marlow Briggs is a great bit of platforming fun.  It's powered by a 3-D engine, and the camera is on rails, but as a bargain title, it more than delivers its quota of fun.

An imperfect but enjoyable cinematic brawler. This is the gaming equivalent of fast food. Cheap but filling if you enjoy this type of gameplay. There are certain design elements that left me scratching my head, such as the story being told during slow motion cutscenes, which seem to be there only to extend playtime. The story itself, is nothing to write home about, infact, its rather terrible, but that isn't wan't this game is about. Its just mindless fun.

In all seriousness, Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death is an absolutely fantastic game. Imagine if Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon had a baby with Indiana Jones, and the baby played like God of War. That's Marlow Briggs. Buy this game.

Every aspect of this game has been carefully designed to make you feel special.\n\n-The achievements are stupid easy to get. Upon getting your first achievement, you will receive a second achievement called Achiever
date:
just for getting your first achievement. That's because you're special, winner!

-It's crazy easy to build up massive combo numbers, of which you will get an achievement for. Because you deserve it, winner!

-The game progresses at a brisk pace. I'm only 2 hours in, and I've already seen things as diverse as a factory to a jungle. You get more experience points than you can use at any given time, and you're already well on your way to mastering your newest skill (which I already have a large amount of) as soon as it unlocks. That's because you're tired of living the grind of life, and you deserve to be treated well, winner!

-Most of all, I feel special while playing this game because I just got something that looks and plays amazing and has a good sense of humor for 99 cents. I feel like I just conned Steam out of a really fun game that's worth at least 20 dollars, kind of like the yard sale down the street that is selling something that costs 250 dollars on ebay for 8 dollars because it's just taking up too much space." I almost feel guilty taking this off Steam's hands for 99 cents
recommended: but I'm not complaining.\n\nThough it may have felt like my review struck a somewhat sarcastic tone at the beginninng

reviewText: The soul of Kratos is reborn as a modern day Black Dynamite, resurrected from the dead by the tiki mask from Crash Bandicoot. Using Death's scythe, you rampage through Micheal Bay's exploding African safari hell to get your girl back.\n\nBest .99 cents I spent, surprisingly fun.

A little jem of a game. I do not ever recall this game being advertised but it is a good game.

The main villian is trying to get immortality. He enlists the help of your girlfriend. When she decides to leave they kill you to make her finish her work. You are brought back to life to stop this guy from getting supernatural abilities. As far as the plot goes, that is about it.

For a pretty straight forword storyline, you travel to many locations and fight a good variety of creatures. The boss battles are interesting and cool looking.

The things that will annoy you  in this game are first off the talking mask that follows you. He is not very informative and seams to suffer from exceptional hindsite. Secondly at certain parts of the game (mostly when getting new upgrades or end of boss battles) the game does a stop motion revolving take of what is going on. As it turns the scenes change and then you go on into the next area. Way to often! Lastly THE INVISIBLE WALLS. there are times when you plan a jump only to hit an invisible wall killing you prompting that mask to make another snide remake about how that should not of happened.

All in all it is a good game with decent fighting mechanics. Not a very hard game but something that will hold your attention for some time.
There is one Quotation which is explainin' the game: Surprise ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥!""

It's a fun hack and slash game with decent graphics and gameplay. I booted it up expecting a buggy piece of mess but was pleasantly surprised by how well the game ran. Not a single glitch throughout my playthrough.

The gameplay is alright. The combat mechanics aren't too complicated. It's an easy to pick up and play game. The story much like the gameplay is ok. The banter between the Mask and Briggs is nicely done and as one would expect, James Hong's voice-work is excellent.

It's an all around solid game worth more than the 0.99$ I paid for it.

I give it a 7/10.
This game feels a lot like God of War.  And it's a steal at the normal price much less if you get it during a steam sale.

The game is just a button masher with 4 super powers 4 melee weaopons and a variety of combos that change nothing really. However the thing is it varies sequences very well - platformer, shooting big guns, slides, little challenges, controlling big enemies, new enemies and etc. You always think it gets repetitve and bam it changes. Not so much in the beggning though.  Hard not to recommed for the current price.   Too bad the banter tween the mask and the protagnoist and the antagonist are far and few in between. The camera can be rather annoying.\n\nThe credit scene game. Do they have to make an annoying one? hahaha

Very fun. New weapons, powers and enemies every so often keep it fun. The mask has some hilarious one liners. Very humorous game.\n\nNot going to win any awards for graphics though. And the camera can sometimes ruin your combo. Would only recommend if you really want the game or it is on sale.

Think God of War meets B action movie with a more likeable protaganist and you'll have Marlow Briggs in a nutshell. Good fun, lots of explosions, funny mask dialog, cheap!  Buy it!

This game is BETTER than God of War 3, though they are basically the same game. The main difference is that this game isn't afraid to make fun of itself and break the fourth wall whenever they want to.

reviewText:
Pierce Washington from the Third Street Saints in his own action flick, with a sarcastic talking mask as his sidekick*.
Yeah it's a bit janky in parts but generally it's a nice solid hack'n'slash platformer. It gets dirt cheap during the sales so get it then, it's well worth it.

(* No, it's not the same sarcastic talking mask sidekick from the Shadow Warrior revival.)
This game is awesome. Great comedic narrative. Gameplay is fluid. Camera angle is a bit annoying, but manageable.

A fun and entertaining brawler that doesn't try to be anything more than it is. The plot is silly, which is what makes this enjoyable. Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death goes over the top from the first second and never looks back.

The port is so-and-so, and some might have a hard time adjusting to the controls, which at times are very clunky. The fighting system is sufficient, although some weapons and powers are fairly useless from the get go, while others become your bread and butter the second you unlock them.

This is a high action brawler with little room for breaks. Unfortunately, several enemies are downright boring to fight, and after a while become overly repetitive. The final boss is suitable for a game like this, but I personally found it to be a chore more than enjoyable.

All in all, if you want several hours worth of entertaining brawling and like B film plots and dialogue, this is well worth picking up.

There are reviews out there saying that this game is one of those that is so bad that it's good. I don't know what they are smoking. Sure, given it's low price i can understand that many start the game with low expectations about it. But i found this game amazing, deserving well more than 5 bucks. As soon as you get to the main menu, you are greeted to one of the best epic main menu songs out there. Everytime i started the game, i couldn't help but listening to the music for at least 2 minutes. The rest of the music are ok, but this song makes up for all of them. Now speaking of the game, it's a ripoff of God of War, but a pretty good one. The story surely sucks, but there's plenty of funny dialog. The graphics are decent and the game is surprisingly well optimized for PC. Now speaking of the gameplay, it's mostly an Hack and Slash. There's a light and a heavy attack that you can combo, and a grab, block and jump buttons. There's 4 weapons and 5 magic powers that you collect, and they all play differently. You can also upgrade them. The combat is good, with a solid variety of enemy types and bosses, but blocking fells a bit off because you can't block in the middle of an attack, so you'll be evading most of the time. Besides combat, there are also sections of platforming (those could be better), puzzle solving, evading obstacles, 3D shooting and top down shooting. Together, it'll last about 6 hours, and if you are like me, you'll play right again on the hardcore difficulty, which isn't really that hard except for some encounters later in the game. For it's price, it has a good lenght. And you can also replay some challenges from the story in the menu with leaderboards, but for me only the first time was added. Probably a bug, but didn't care much about it. And there's also a minigame in the credits, which sucks but lets you skip the credits the faster you complete it. It was a nice addition to finish the game. In the end, the game isn't brilliant, but surprisingly good given it's price, and you should definitely get it if you're a fan of Hack and Slash games. And one sale, it's a steal.

So here's the deal: Marlow Briggs is just an average dude, visiting his girlfriend Eva somewhere in the jungle of South America, working for an old chinese man, translating mayan artefacts. Unfortunately Marlow gets killed with an ancient weapon and his girlfriend is kidnapped. Instead of dying, Marlow gets infused with an ancient power, becoming the sacred warrior, whose prophecy it is to protect the the old artefacts. His only aim is to rescue his girlfriend and stopping the old chinese of destroying the world. Xibalba can wait. Under the guidance of his new buddy, a flying mask, he starts to fight everything the jungle and militia have to offer - or he is just making some damn silly jokes. The gameplay isn't special. It's a God of War/Devil May Cry clone, but the copy works flawless and is entertaining and challenging. The optics are nice and the soundtrack is very good. All in all a very solid game for a low price.\n\nBonus: the most creative use of endgame credits. People with long names suck!

reviewText:
A little jem of a game. I do not ever recall this game being advertised but it is a good game.

The main villian is trying to get immortality. He enlists the help of your girlfriend. When she decides to leave they kill you to make her finish her work. You are brought back to life to stop this guy from getting supernatural abilities. As far as the plot goes, that is about it.

For a pretty straight forword storyline, you travel to many locations and fight a good variety of creatures. The boss battles are interesting and cool looking.

The things that will annoy you  in this game are first off the talking mask that follows you. He is not very informative and seams to suffer from exceptional hindsite. Secondly at certain parts of the game (mostly when getting new upgrades or end of boss battles) the game does a stop motion revolving take of what is going on. As it turns the scenes change and then you go on into the next area. Way to often! Lastly THE INVISIBLE WALLS. there are times when you plan a jump only to hit an invisible wall killing you prompting that mask to make another snide remake about how that should not of happened.

All in all it is a good game with decent fighting mechanics. Not a very hard game but something that will hold your attention for some time.

we find much positives from Darksiders there, you role a back sexy tough guy and bring your power to save your love, stage is easy and various, brutal action in battle and linear storyline, also in sale it is really cheap
Cool. But it's better with a controller than the keyboard.

An absurd game that's essentially God of War developed by Michael Bay sooo lotta explosions. You're some black guy with an Ooka Ooka ally trying to save your girlfriend and thwart an asian man's evil intentions. The game is self aware. You're not meant to take the game seriously and that's why it can get away with its level of ridiculousness. Your exchanges with Ooka Ooka are very frequent and well done. When you're not focusing on these funny chats, you're spinning till your winning. The combat is blatantly a God of War rip-off (which doesn't bother me) so its free flowing and satisfying with a nice variety of weapons, spells and movesets. It's a kill anything that moves type of affair and the over the top cutscenes just add to the wonderful chaos. It's a daft decoration of death and destruction and you should play it because of that.

Enjoyed it quite a bit, the dialogue and characters are passable and often pretty hilarious.

The cutscenes have, a..for the lack of a better term, sequential art style, that I really liked.

Worth it.
Price:Fun ratio = 100%

Ok, so here's the review for Marlow Briggs!

Short review - This game was FUN!

First off, this game had been sitting in my library for a very long time. It was just that I had to take out time for a third person story driven game. But once I started to play this game, I wanted to play through it completely, cause I found it fun! Where most of the games become a chore sometimes, this one was actually fun. Though if you are really a game critic you may not review this game very highly. Its understandable, I think this is one of those games, you would play once and be done with. Somehow the fun element in this game reminded me of console games back in the 90s, with revamped twist to it.

Main points
* Third person story driven hack n slash type
* main empahsis is on the story, and you getting to beat up the enemies.
* The game isn't all that difficult but still decently challenging.
* Beating the enemies is repetitive, but you won't really get bored cause the game is mainly story driven, and a lot is happening all the time. Things really change with the scenery and all, so you don't get bored of the beat em up!
* Also the game is short, at about 8 hours I completed it, and I liked it!

Verdict-
If you are looking for a fun game, that you wanna pick up and play to relax or just chill perhaps, you will find what you are looking for. Also, this game isn't a time sink, you'll pretty much be able to unlock all the abilities and get almost all the achievements on steam in about 8 hours time!

So at the end you'll be all happy happy! :)

Describing Marlow Briggs to someone would be easy. It’s an over the top, in your face action and comedic hack and slash. I definitely enjoyed my playthrough of it.

You play as Marlow, trying to save your girlfriend, Eva, after she is taken hostage to decipher some ancient codices. I was quite surprised with the range of environments that you are taken through. They are nicely done too and feel full and rich.

An odd thing to point out, but I will. The game sets up the “camera” to be the Mask of Death following you around. Or at least that’s how I interpreted it. Reminded me of how Mario 64 implied the Lakitu Brothers were “filming you” during gameplay.

Since we are on the camera, there is a love/hate relationship with it. The camera is FIXED and you cannot control it. This can, and is, used to hide secrets and extra experience points that are out of view until you explore a little. Generally, it’s good and doesn’t get in the way. But on occasion, especially during battle, it will not let you see where the enemy is. It also tended to lag behind if I started moving too fast. The multiple rope swinging segments are brought to mind where this happened. In the end, it wasn’t too much of a nuisance.

Marlow Briggs is extremely linear. I don’t mind this at all in games, but I know this is a personal preference. There are invisible walls everywhere and you cannot explore much outside your destined path. I say can’t explore “much” because you can go in little crevices and off camera areas that give you experience. It definitely rewards you for doing what little exploring you can.

Controls feel relatively tight during combat and responsive during the many platforming segments. I would highly recommend a controller to play this game. It was released on the 360 and it shows. The mouse and keyboard controls are awkward and I immediately switched to a controller. The game switches seamlessly between the two, which is appreciated.

Marlow can upgrade and acquire a few more weapons and magic powers throughout the playthough. You can switch quickly and easily between them for whatever situation you’re in. I tended to stick with the weapon that was on a chain for a majority of the game after I acquired it. It’s the only ranged weapon and felt the most safe using it. It was also easy to break out of a combo and dodge an enemy attack. The magic powers are visually cool, but consistently felt underpowered. They were expensive to use (Mana) and would usually not even kill the smaller enemies. I wish they were quite a bit more powerful or used less Mana.

Saving is spectacular. Tons of auto-saves and you can save manually at any point. I always love to see this in games.

Graphically the game is quite good! I found myself taking a lot of screenshots because of the really nice looking environments I was in. However, there are NO graphics options to play around with. You get to choose your resolution and if it’s full screen or not. That’s it…

Sound and music is good. I felt some of the epic songs got tired since they were used a lot during the cut scenes.

Let’s get to the Pros and Cons

Pros
+Awesome, over the top action. All the explosions you could ask for
+Nice graphics
+Great auto and manual save system
+Controls feel good (use a controller to play!)
+Fantastic variety of environments
+Solid variety of enemies. (Possessed enemies are recycled)
+Weapon combos are cool
+Good game length. Not too short or long.
+Rewarded for the small amount of exploring you can do
+60fps throughout

Cons
+No graphics options?! (Just resolution and full screen toggle)
+Magic powers felt weak, cost too much Mana
+Puzzles could be more challenging
+Camera at times can be frustrating
+Slightly repetitive

Worth the $5 asking price and a “must buy” if it’s on some type of sale or in a bundle. I had a great time playing Marlow Briggs. The gripes I had are easily overlooked by the crazy action everywhere.

8.5/10

Admit it.  We all loved God of War.  When those games first hit the market, videos games as an industry woul never be the same.  In a market that constantly demands innovation, development of new concepts and methods of interaction, it can be easy to forget how amazing certain tried and true formula can be.  I STILL love playing God of War...  and this game, is a shameless clone/update, call it what you will.  Graphically upated, and skinned in a different mythos, Kratos becomes Marlow.\n\nThis games isn't promising anything revolutionary.  It also refuses to take itself seriously.  The production value is solid, the voice acting well done.  The narrator that is Marlow's spirit guide" i suppose
date: is constantly making wise cracks.  I found the game delightful.\n\nEvery time I wanted to put the controller down
recommended: it kept pulling me back in...  a familiar feeling.  It isn't perfect and it doesn't reinvent the wheel
hoursPlayed:
but it brought back a play style and experience that I feel you don't find enough in modern gaming.  I think someone described it as being able to play a 90's action blockbuster....  fairly dead on.

Get it on sale and you will not be dissapointed.  It's FUN.  Engaging and you will not have to think to hard.  Everyting in it takes place on an epic scale.  An abundance of great Mini-games too.

I am not finished with the game at this point.  I did notice the absence of any MEGA boss fights (Kratos vs the hydra  or kraken) but perhaps those are to come."

reviewText: Playing Marlow Briggs is playing through a walking paradox. No game with this small a budget should look this good, no game with this small a team should PLAY this good, and no premise as absurd as this should work as well as it does. Yes, it's short, but it's also dirt cheap, and the four hours I spent on this game alone make it an incredibly worthwhile experience. It's funny, amazingly well paced, looks great and has some suprisingly good combat for being a God of War clone. It's a game I think everyone should play at least 20 minutes of, so they can see and bask in the glory of Marlow ♥♥♥♥ing Briggs.\n\nWhat i'm trying to say is that you should play this game because it's really damn good.
You want God of War on the PC, well here it is. It's anm over the top action movie setting, but it works well and the game plays well.
Fun Gameplay and good humor. A fresh air in this genre
